column4: OK SO THE COMP IS TO OLD TO RUN LIVE UBUNTU CD - but it runs ubuntu with compiz great - welll not to old just not enoughmemory for live cd - i chnged my screen resolution last night and its not supported - so now once i enter user/pswd i get black screen - can someone tell me how to fix this in the terminal - that is the only thing i can boot have the failsafe terminal on screen now - what is next??????
`dpkg-reconfigure xorg-server` ?
sounds like the resolution that xorg server is attempting isn't supported by your flatscreen?  -a crt would likely work thought?
er.. perhaps `dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg`
`dpkg -l '*xorg*' |grep ^i` will show you if it is
no prob
- HOW much memory KB do i give to the video card???????????
if modern video card, leave blank
the default choices are fine in most* cases
- dont know laptop
- default is zero - should i give it 32KB?????
no.  leave blank/zero
I believe that's asking for what mem the kernel should reserve for yer card IF the card dosn't already have (or ask for on it's own?) it's own mem
do i ese framebuffer device interface????
no.  don't need/use fb device
enjoy
save a copy of yer /etc/X11/xorg.conf  ;)

- why didndt i get a login in screen it was alll fizzy black and white only like a haze - i just guessed and enterd usr/pswd and it worked, how do i save a copy of /etc/X11/xorg.conf - just got to that directory find it save as and add backup 2 title?????
`sudo cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf ~/`
er, sudo not required
`cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf ~/Desktop/` to copy it to yer desktop..  putting a copy back will restore, etc
email it to yerself or ftp it somwhere, IMHO
